>
> On 4/21/10 7:34 AM, Jens Bengtsson w=
rote:
> > Hi!
> >
> > I want to specify an OnHostsDecideRule and the Crawl =
Scope documentation says:
> >
> > "This DecideRule applies the configured d=
ecision to any URI that is in one of the hosts of the configured set."
> >
=
> > How do I define the configured set?
> >
> > What do I need besides the =
following?
> >
> > <bean class=3D"org.archive.modules.deciderules.surt.OnHo=
stsDecideRule">
> >            <property name=3D"decision" value=3D"ACCEPT"=
/>
> >   </bean>
> 
> 
> OnHostsDecideRule is a specialization of SurtPrefi=
xedDecideRule.
> 
> Both these rules can build their internal list of confi=
gured prefixes 
> (against which URIs are tested) from one or both of:
> 
>=
 (1) the crawl's configured seeds -- if setting property 
> seedsAsSurtPref=
ixes is true (which is the default)
> 
> (2) a supplied file of URIs or pre=
fixes, one to a line, via the 
> 'surtsSourceFile' setting property (a path=
 to the file to use)
> 
> In addition to the usual ways that desired prefix=
es are deduced from 
> URIs but SurtPrefixedDecideRule, for OnHostsDecideRu=
le all prefixes are 
> truncated to the host component.
> 
> For example, S=
urtPrefixedDecideRule will turn the URI 
> <http://example.com/images/> int=
o the implied SURT prefix 
> <http://(com,example,)/images/>. OnHostsDecide=
Rule will further truncate 
> that prefix to <http://(com,example,)/>, caus=
ing more URIs to be matched.
> 
> Everything OnHostsDecideRule can do, Surt=
PrefixedDecideRule can do, too 
> -- if SurtPrefixedDecideRule is supplied =
with URIs/prefixes already 
> limited to the host-portion. For that reason,=
 OnHostsDecideRule might be 
> discouraged/deprecated/deleted someday, so t=
hat there aren't redundant 
> ways to achieve the same effect.
> 
> - Gordo=
